page.title: 08Health
page.content: HEALTH The local surgery was built in 1970 and is situated next to the community centre.There are two doctors, Dr Garlick and Dr Davies. The administration of the surgery is by two full-time staff, a medical manager and secretary. There are 3 part-time staff involved with the 3700 patients. The surgery handles about 150-200 visiting patients per week, and the doctors make in excess of 300 house calls weekly.There are three district nurses attached, one of whom is a midwife and health visitor. There is one patient 100 years old and about 17% are over 65 years old. The doctors have 3 other surgeries outside our area, so covering a very large area.
